questions.question: The lecture was so interesting that the audience sat ……………………….
questions.description: Here the adjective motionless describes the noun audience, not their sitting.

questions.question: The movie I watched yesterday was ………………………….. boring.
questions.description: Fairly is not normally used with negative ideas.

questions.question: Raju worked ……………………. to succeed.
questions.description: Hard can be an adjective and an adverb hardly is similar to scarcely.

questions.question: The ointment ………………………….. his pain.
questions.description: To alleviate pain is to lessen pain.

questions.question: My hen …………………………. twenty eggs last month.
questions.description: When lie means recline, its past tense is lay. Hens lay eggs. The past tense of lay is laid.

questions.question: He is always ……………………….. towards his teachers and elders.
questions.description: Respectful means showing respect respectable means worthy of being respected.

questions.question: They tried to solve the dispute …………………………..
questions.description: Amiable refers to the friendly disposition of people amicable refers to goodwill.

questions.question: We may ……………………….. the game.
questions.description: Loose is the opposite of tight.

questions.question: I would have loved to invite all of my friends to my wedding but it was not ……………………………
questions.description: Practicable means that can be put into practice.

questions.question: He gave a ………………………… account of rural India.
Gandhi believed in the ……………………………. of truth and non-violence.
